title: Muon Space and Earth Fire Alliance to build constellation for wildfire detection and response
summary: The first three ‘FireSats’ are projected to launch in 2026

title: Maxar inks agreement with Lockheed Martin to supply imagery for F-35 training simulators
summary: Lockheed Martin will use Maxar’s imagery basemaps and 3d models

title: China’s Chang’e-6 is carrying a surprise rover to the moon
summary: China’s Chang’e-6 spacecraft appears to carry a previously undisclosed lunar rover as part of the mission’s far side exploration plans.

title: The surprise is not that Boeing lost commercial crew but that it finished at all
summary: "The structural inefficiency was a huge deal."

title: Starliner mission to be first crewed Atlas 5 flight
summary: The upcoming launch of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner will mark not just the first time the spacecraft has carried astronauts but also the first crewed launch of the Atlas 5, a vehicle approaching its retirement.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy May 5-11, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of May 5-11, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session […]

title: Ship 30 set to Static Fire next week as Flight 4 Preparations Continue
summary: SpaceX has rolled out Ship 30 to complete its engine testing campaign and has completed Booster 13’s cryogenic proof testing. Meanwhile, upgrades and preparations continue ahead of Flight 4, which could happen by the end of May.

title: Russia may skip first operational Starliner mission
summary: Even a successful crewed test flight of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner vehicle could create a temporary hiccup in plans to exchange seats between commercial crew vehicles and Soyuz spacecraft going to the International Space Station.

title: SpaceX reveals EVA suit design as Polaris Dawn mission approaches
summary: SpaceX has unveiled long-awaited spacesuits intended for spacewalks that will first be used on an upcoming private spaceflight.

title: Starliner Ready for Human Spaceflight Debut
summary: Following a Flight Readiness Review today, Boeing and NASA officials confirmed Starliner is ready for launch on Monday with two NASA astronauts aboard. Starliner has flown twice already without a […]
